title: Terrain Starter Pack
description: Terrain Starter Pack is a set of textured meshes of trees, rocks, flowers and rocks, heightmaps, particle systems and a procedural terrain material to help quickly start with terrain development.
longDescription:
Terrain Starter Pack is a combination of textured meshes, heightmaps, particle systems and a procedural terrain material for helping head start terrain development in your project.


The meshes include flowers, rocks, grass and trees, each with 3 LODs. The heightmaps are randomly created maps that can be imported to the landscape tool and generate terrains without much effort. The particle systems are of simple fog, leaves flying around, a bird in orbit and simple snowfall. The procedural material renders grass and rocks as per the angle of the vertices, but take them to a bigger height, and grass slowly fades to snow. Similar effect exists on the meshes and all of them are completely controllable. Users can also easily change to their own textures as they like.


In time I do plan to keep updating the pack with more meshes and may be something else too. I can very well do with some suggestions or requests in my inbox or in the comments section!
technicalDetails:
PBR: Yes.

Collision: Yes.

LODs on meshes: Yes, 3 per mesh.

Number of Meshes: 15.

Number of Textures: 105 (including textures specific to meshes).

Textures Sizes: 512x512

Number of Materials and Instances: 26.

Number of Particle Systems: 4.

Engine Compatibility: 4.16 and above.

Intended Platforms: Desktops, VR and consoles.

Platforms Tested: Windows PC.

Documentation Included: Yes.

Documentation Link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/13nz46OqyWYe7tppA4a-XyftTbQG8-9BmL3yrdESJ-NU/edit?usp=sharing

releaseInfo.releaseNote: Better rendering with post processes and LUTs. 4 Particle Systems for snow, leaves flying, basic fog and a bird in orbit added.
